intro: Diasperus microbotrys, commonly known as the small-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stems. Diasperus microbotrys thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
